item.title: Philippines allows use of antigen test to detect COVID-19
item.description: The Philippines has allowed the use of the antigen test that detects cases of COVID-19 rapidly, Malacañang said Tuesday.

item.title: Robredo questions Duterte's pardon of Pemberton: Patas at makatarungan ba ito?
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte's granting of absolute pardon to US Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton, convicted for the 2014 killing of Filipino transgender woman Jennifer Laude, is unfair and unjust, Vice President Leni Robredo said Tuesday.

item.title: BuCor preparing for Pemberton release, says no special treatment
item.description: "Ito pong kaso ni Pemberton ay tinuturing namin na first time at 'yung pag-process naman sa kanya ay hindi naman po natin binibigyan ng espesyal na turing. We consider it as an ordinary release," BuCor spokesman Gabriel Chaclag told Dobol B sa News TV.

item.title: US bishop-elect resigns over sexual abuse allegation, Pope Francis accepts resignation
item.description: An American bishop-elect has resigned just weeks before he was due to start the job, following an allegation that he had sexually abused a minor, Catholic Church officials said on Monday.

item.title: Lorenzana denies military occupying Lumad communities
item.description: Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana strongly denied on Tuesday that government troops are occupying Lumad communities across the country.

item.title: Pemberton pardon did not undergo 'normal process' --DOJ Usec. Perete
item.description: The pardon granted to US Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton, convicted for killing transgender Filipino woman Jennifer Laude in 2014, did not undergo "normal process," a Department of Justice (DOJ) official said Tuesday.

item.title: Solon questions increased 'sovereignty fund' under proposed DND budget for 2021
item.description: "Kaya kine-kwestiyon natin sa DND how will the P41.4 billion is spent kung walang gagawin ang AFP (Armed Forces of the Philippines) sa China's military exercises," Gabriela Women's Party Representative Arlene Brosas said.

item.title: DOJ chief: 'No one prompted' Duterte to pardon Pemberton
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte's decision to grant absolute pardon to convicted US Marine Joseph Scott Pemberton was unprompted and "solely his own," Justice Secretary Menardo Guevarra said.

item.title: IATF suspends travel of LSIs to Western Visayas, Iligan, Lanao del Sur
item.description: Locally stranded individuals (LSIs) will be prohibited from entering Western Visayas, Iligan City and Lanao del Sur for the meantime as the government seeks to contain the spread of COVID-19 in these areas, Malacañang said Tuesday.

item.title: 'Why are they terribly threatened of NTF-ELCAC?' Badoy says of Makabayan solons
item.description: Undersecretary Lorraine Badoy on Monday asked why Makabayan lawmakers are "terribly threatened" with the National Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict's approach in ending communist terrorism.

item.title: Pemberton paid damages to Laude family ordered in 2015 only this August --lawyer
item.description: US Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton paid civil damages to the family of slain transgender Filipino Jennifer Laude only on August 25 this year, more than four years after the court gave the order to do so, according to the family's lawyer.

item.title: Duterte 'cleared' Duque of wrongdoing in PhilHealth mess, says Lacson
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte virtually "cleared" Health Secretary Francsico Duque III of any wrongdoing when he told him not to resign despite being implicated in the PhilHealth mess, Senator Panfilo Lacson said Tuesday.

item.title: Duterte abused power in granting absolute pardon to Pemberton --Laude s lawyer
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte abused his power in pardoning US Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton who killed transgender Filipino Jennifer Laude in 2014, the lawyer of the victim s family said.

item.title: Gov t eyeing to enforce ban on home quarantine -- Año
item.description: The national government is eyeing to strictly ban home quarantine to prevent the transmission of COVID-19 among households, Interior Secretary Eduardo Año said Tuesday.

item.title: Lawyer to Duterte: Jennifer Laude was unfairly treated, not Pemberton
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte's statement that US Lance Corporal Joseph Scott Pemberton, convicted for killing transgender Filipino woman Jennifer Laude in 2014, was unfairly treated was without basis, according to the victim's camp.
